alert.note: Alert for Mendocino Coast; Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Lake County; Southwestern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 8:08AM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED DURING THE CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY... .A series of cold upper level storm systems has lowered snow levels to around 2000 feet this morning, and may occasionally drop snow levels to sea level Saturday night through Monday morning. Periods of heavy showers spreading across the cold airmass will favor significant mountain snowfall lasting through Monday morning. Travel across mountain roadways and highway passes will subsequently be difficult if not impossible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches possible. * WHERE...Mendocino Coast, Southeastern Mendocino Interior, Southwestern Mendocino Interior and Southern Lake Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

area.areaDesc: Mendocino Coast; Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Lake County; Southwestern Mendocino Interior
